examples.text: the **sole surviving** member of the family
My **sole reason** for coming here was to see you.
This is the sole means of access to the building.

definitions.definition: belonging to one person or group; not shared

examples.text: She has **sole responsibility** for the project.
We may have the opportunity to take over sole ownership of the company.

wordOrigin: adjective late Middle English (also in the senses ‘secluded’ and ‘unrivalled’): from Old French soule, from Latin sola, feminine of solus ‘alone’.
